title: tPA (Alteplase) Dosing for Ischemic Stroke Calculator
description: Calculates alteplase dose for ischemic stroke treatment using weight-based dosing protocol with bolus and infusion components

result.name: dosing_regimen
result.description: Complete tPA dosing regimen with total dose, bolus, and infusion amounts

ranges.interpretation: Administer 10% as IV bolus over 1 minute, followed by 90% as continuous infusion over 60 minutes
Patients >100 kg receive maximum 90 mg total dose due to safety limitations

references: The National Institute of Neurological Disorders and Stroke rt-PA Stroke Study Group. Tissue plasminogen activator for acute ischemic stroke. N Engl J Med. 1995 Dec 14;333(24):1581-7. doi: 10.1056/NEJM199512143332401.

Hacke W, Kaste M, Bluhmki E, Brozman M, Dávalos A, Guidetti D, et al. Thrombolysis with alteplase 3 to 4.5 hours after acute ischemic stroke. N Engl J Med. 2008 Sep 25;359(13):1317-29. doi: 10.1056/NEJMoa0804656.

Powers WJ, Rabinstein AA, Ackerson T, Adeoye OM, Bambakidis NC, Becker K, et al. Guidelines for the Early Management of Patients With Acute Ischemic Stroke: 2019 Update to the 2018 Guidelines for the Early Management of Acute Ischemic Stroke. Stroke. 2019 Dec;50(12):e344-e418. doi: 10.1161/STR.0000000000000211.
formula: Total Dose (mg) = 0.9 × Weight (kg), maximum 90 mg. Bolus = 10% of total dose over 1 minute. Infusion = 90% of total dose over 60 minutes.
notes: Standard dose is 0.9 mg/kg with maximum total dose of 90 mg
Administer 10% as IV bolus over 1 minute, remaining 90% as infusion over 60 minutes
Maximum dose cap of 90 mg applies to patients >100 kg for safety
Only for acute ischemic stroke within 3-4.5 hours of symptom onset
Do NOT use for acute coronary syndrome or pulmonary embolism
Up to 20 mL (20 mg) tPA may remain in pump tubing
Flush with 50 mL of 0.9% sodium chloride after tPA infusion
Contraindicated in hemorrhagic stroke or active bleeding
Requires careful patient selection and monitoring for bleeding complications
Must be administered in stroke-capable facility with appropriate monitoring
